entries.title: Apple Revenue and Profit Down as iPhone Sales Slow
entries.description: The iPhone maker said sales of its flagship product were down 8 percent as it dealt with a factory shutdown and worries about rising inflation.

entries.title: Amazon Reports Almost No Profit and Slowing Growth
entries.description: The company indicated the slowing growth and tight margins would continue in the first three months of this year.

entries.title: Alphabet’s Profit Falls 34% Amid Ads Slowdown
entries.description: Google’s parent company reported its fourth consecutive drop in quarterly profit, weeks after culling 6 percent of its work force to cut costs.

entries.title: Meta Soars by Most in Decade, Adding $100 Billion in Value
entries.description: Mark Zuckerberg’s company recorded its biggest daily market gain in nearly a decade, as the mood brightens among tech investors.

entries.title: Ford Said Sales in January Increased 2%
entries.description: The company’s deliveries of electric vehicles more than doubled, compared with the same month a year earlier.

entries.title: Senator Calls on Apple and Google to Ban TikTok in App Stores
entries.description: Michael F. Bennet, a Colorado Democrat, cited national security, adding to bipartisan pressure on the Chinese-owned video app.
